observation_note.title: Enter a tree observation
observation_note.text: It's easy to do and will not take you too long.

trees_changed_alert.title: Attention!
trees_changed_alert.text: We recently changed some trees and their species, as well as their location. Please be careful when searching by number (#x)!

error_loading.text: Could not load tree data. Please try again later.

step1.tree_search_placeholder: Enter Country, City, Street, Species or ID...
step1.title: Your tree
step1.map_error_text: Could not load map data. Please choose a tree below manually.

step2.nothing_to_observe: There is nothing to observe set up for this tree. Should you suspect a mistake, please contact a system administrator.

help.title: Check the following objects and tick the most fitting image for each

step3.title: Documentation
step3.upload_photo_placeholder: Choose a photo of the tree

help.description: You must enter your name and the naes of everyone observing with you and can optionally upload a picture of the tree if you want and add additional remarks.

step3.photo_type_invalid: The photo must be of type PNG or JPEG.
step3.photo_size_invalid: The photo must not be larger than 5 MB.

status.duplicate: There is already an observation at the given time.
status.generic: Please try submitting again in a few moments. If you refresh the page, your observation data is lost.

success.title: Success
success.text: Your observation has been successfully submitted.

tree_list.error: We could not load the tree list, please try again.

error.text: We could not load the given tree, please try again.

login.heading: Your Project-Account
login.status_connection_insecure: You may not log in using an insecure connection
login.status_bad_credentials: Username and password were not recognized
login.status_expired: Your login expired, please log in again
login.status_force_credentials_confirm: Please confirm your password to access the requested page
login.status_not_authenticated: Please log in to view this page
login.status_insufficient_permissions: You are not allowed to access the requested page
login.description: Your personal project account enables you to enter phenology observations, access project-related news and much more.
login.disclaimer:
We don't store any personal data except those needed for scientific research clearly marked to be sent off for submission.
No automated E-Mails are sent out at any time to any user.
By logging in you agree to store your personal login information inside your browser.
login.reset_info:
Your new password must meet these requirements:
  • Contains at least 1 lowercase letter (a-z)
  • Contains at least 1 UPPERCASE letter (A-Z)
  • Contains at least 1 number (0-9)
  • Contains at least 1 symbol (!§$%&/()=?"'+#<>,..-*~)
  • Is at least 10 characters long
login.username_change_info:
Your new username must meet these requirements:
  • Is at least 5 characters long
  • Is different to your current username
  • Does not already exist
login.username_change_failed: Your username could not be changed
login.failed_attempts_info: Your account will be locked for 5 minutes after 10 failed login attempts.
login.change_password_failed: Your password could not be changed, check if your old password is correct
login.change_password_failed_nooldpw: Your password could not be changed, please contact an admin

summary.title: Information
summary.text:
„Urban Trees as climate messengers“: in this project researchers and students, experts and teachers from Austria, Germany and Hungary collaborate. By montoring, measuring and modelling of phenological phases and microclimate data, serve to answer the following research questions: How do urban trees affect urban climate? How does urban climate influence the trees? How can these trees affect our future?

The following visualisations show selected aspects of this research.

through_year.title: Trees through the seasons
through_year.text: This image set shows the leaf development of the trees in spring and illustrates a central research objective in the project: We investigate the length of the vegetation period of different types of urban trees and the influence of urban heat island intensity. City trees cool the city and make it liveable!

cooling_power.title: Cooling capacity of our examined trees
cooling_power.text:
The highest measured cooling capacity of our observed trees was 5,3 °C.
To do that, we compared the temperatures of the reference-beacons in the sun to the beacons in the tree-crowns at each school, and looked at the differences between them.

details.heading: Beacon Data
details.none_attached: No beacons are attached to this tree.
details.status_locked: This beacon can currently not be read out, because the connection credentials are unknown.
details.status_invalid_settings: This beacon can currently not be read out, because incorrect configuration prevents read-out.
details.status_initial: This beacon was newly deployed to this location. It has not yet been read out.

transfer.failed: Failed to get beacon data for this tree!

message.title: Thank you!
message.text: You helped transfer {{amount}} datasets just now!

data.error: Could not load this beacons' data
data.missing: Select a different timespan to display data

all_time.info_popover: Data below might be interpolated if too much data would be shown otherwise.

audioimg.incompatible: Your browser unfortunately does not support this audio format.

general.input_annotation: Search results update automatically while typing.

map.error_default_text: Could not load map data. Please try again.

language.title: Language
language.desc: Choose which language to use for the whole site.

account.title: Manage Account
account.desc_2: Change your username or password here.

support.title: Request Support
support.desc: Request help from - or report problems to - the project team.

delete_account.title: Delete Account
delete_account.desc: If you want to delete your account once and for all, you can do that here.

missing.title: Page not found
missing.desc: It seems you have been linked to a non-existent page. Use the links above to navigate.

beacons.title: Beacon Data
beacons.desc: Find single beacons and their data here.

beaconreadouts.title: Beacon Readouts
beaconreadouts.desc: Here you can see how often project participants read out our Bluetooth-Beacons every day. Every one of these read-outs helps us a tremendous amount and is hugely appreciated!

phenologyobs.title: Phenology Observations
phenologyobs.desc: Here you can see how often project participants conducted a phenology observation. Every one of these observations takes about 10 minutes and helps a lot!

data.title: What data is collected?
data.desc: The following things are currently registered with our system.

phenology.title: Phenology
phenology.desc: We regularly observe trees' buds and check whether they are open, half-open or still closed. This gives us very valuable data to compare trees between different locations.

imprint.title: Imprint
imprint.title_disclaimer: Some of the information below is only available in german
imprint.os_projects_text: Following is a list of open source projects used to create this website.

home.title: Welcome to Urban Trees!
home.desc: You can use this site to enter phenology data for trees, read information and statistics about trees and beacons and gain experience points for helping us collect data!
home.desc_user_2: or beacon readouts (using the android app). When logged in, you can earn experience points and advance your level by completing one of these activities.

admin_console.title: Admin Console
admin_console.desc: Admins can add trees, beacons and announcements in the admin console.

project_intro.title: What we do
project_intro.desc: We monitor lots of trees with Bluetooth-beacons and by hand with what's called »Phenology observation«. They are entered by interested students in three counties around europe.

more_info.title: More information
more_info.desc: Find out more about the Urban Trees as climate messengers-Project on our info-website with lots of additional project details.

user_overview.desc_level_5+:
Wow, you've already earned {{xp}} XP!
Great job! Thank you for helping us collect all this information.
user_overview.desc_level_1-5:
You've earned {{xp}} XP!
Thank you so much for helping us collect more data!
user_overview.desc_level_0:
You have not yet earned any XP!
Consider contributing and earning XP by reading out beacons and submitting phenology observations.

phen_obs.title: Phenology Observation
phen_obs.desc: Enter a new phenology observation here. The five steps below can be completed in less than 5 minutes and give us valuable data about the selected tree and the city it's in.

step_2.title: When?
step_2.obs_past: Observation was done in the past

step_3.title: Observe the selected tree
step_3.no_obs_assoc: No observations are associated with the selected tree
step_3.obs_type_desc: Select {{type.objects.length}} random {{type_name_plural_lc}} from your tree. For each {{type_name_lc}}, click the image that most closely resembles it once.
step_3.undo_info_cursor: You can also undo by right-clicking.
step_3.undo_info_touch: You can also undo by long-pressing.

step_4.title: Upload a picture
step_4.desc: You may optionally upload an image of the observed tree.

step_5.title: Who observed?
step_5.manual: Enter all people involved with this observation.

send.title: Send
send.desc: Once the above information has been sent, it can't be changed anymore. Please make sure it's correct before you send it. If you press discard, the form will be reset and you may start over.
send.reward_text: Once you send this observation, you will receive {{xp}} XP.
send.reward_text_multiple_users: Once you send this observation, every user will receive {{xp}} XP.
send.error_duplicate: There is already an observation at given time

report.title: What kind of problem do you need help with?

technical_problem.desc: This includes problems with beacon readout issues, the android app and the website.

other_problem.desc: This includes problems regarding how phenology observation is done, how manual beacon readout is done etc.

report.title: Report technical issue
report.desc: Enter your question or issue below.

user_reports.title: Your reports
user_reports.desc: Below you can see all your reports for technical issues, comments by the team and their resolution.
user_reports.desc_annotation: Resolved issues are only shown when they were active less than 3 months ago.

auth_timeout.title: Your access for this site has expired!
auth_timeout.subtitle: Log in here again before taking any other actions to avoid losing your progress.
